snippet: A strong majority says steps need to be taken urgently to assure that the fruits of the economic recovery are shared among income classes, according to the New York Times/CBS News poll.
abstract: New York Times/CBS News poll finds majority of Americans are concerned about income and wealth inequality and suggests issue will be main one in 2016 presidential election; widely shared sentiment explains why both Democratic and Republican politicians have been making populist appeals.

byline.original: By NOAM SCHEIBER and DALIA SUSSMAN
byline.contributor: Megan Thee-Brenan and Marina Stefan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A strong majority says steps need to be taken urgently to assure that the fruits of the economic recovery are shared among income classes, according to the New York Times/CBS News poll.

headline.main: Inequality Troubles Americans Across Party Lines, Times/CBS Poll Finds
headline.print_headline: Inequality Troubles Americans Across Party Lines, a Poll Finds
